===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ひょうぶ'}} {{m|zh|屏風|tr=beng pjuwng}}. Compare modern simplified {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{m|zh|屏风|tr=píngfēng}}. First mention in Japanese recorded history was in reference to a gift in 686 from the Silla kingdom on the Korean peninsula.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=on|びょうぶ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|びょうぶ|hhira=びやうぶ}}

# a [[folding screen]]

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|屏風岩|びょうぶ いわ}}: a [[sheer]] [[cliff]], a [[wall]] of [[rock]]
* {{ja-r|屏風絵|びょうぶ え}}: a [[painting]] on a [[folding screen]]
* {{ja-l|屏風押さえ}}, {{ja-l|屏風押え}}, {{ja-r|屏風押|びょうぶ おさえ}}: a [[lead]] or [[ceramic]] [[weight]] used to prop up a folding screen and keep it from falling over
* {{ja-l|屏風返し}}, {{ja-r|屏風反し|びょうぶがえし}}: falling over flat, much as a falling screen will fall over
* {{ja-r|屏風草|びょうぶぐさ}}: alternate for {{m|ja|防風|tr=bōfū}}, {{taxlink|Saposhnikovia seseloides|species|noshow=1|ver=161023}} or {{taxlink|Saposhnikovia divaricata|species|noshow=1|ver=161023}}, of [[family]] [[Apiaceae]], used in Chinese medicine ([[w:Kampo|kanpō]])
* {{ja-r|屏風倒し|びょうぶだおし}}: [[knock over|knocking]] something [[knock over|over]] [[flat]], much as a folding screen will fall over
* {{ja-r|屏風山|びょうぶ やま}}: a [[mountain]] with a very [[straight]] [[ridgeline]], much like the top of a [[folding screen]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Idioms====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|屏風と商人は直にては立たぬ|びょうぶ と あきんど は すぐ にて は たたぬ}}: "folding screens and business people don't get set up immediately" → setting up a folding screen or a business relationship takes time and preparation
* {{ja-r|屏風と商人は曲がらねば世に立たず|びょうぶ と あきんど は まがらねば よ に たたず}}: "folding screens and business people won't stand in this world if they don't bend" → both folding screens and business people must be capable of bending (being flexible) if they are to stand up properly (be successful)
* {{ja-r|屏風を返す|びょうぶ を かえす}}: to [[knock over|knock]] something [[knock over|over]] [[flat]], much as a folding screen will fall over
* {{ja-r|屏風畳に炭油|びょうぶ たたみ に すみ あぶら}}: "folding screen / tatami mats, and charcoal / oil" → the various [[sundry|sundries]] needed for a [[household]]
{{der-bottom}}
